results.title: The Kelly gang
results.brief_description: Restored by the National Film and Sound Archive, this film represents a substantial proportion of the original footage produced by Harry Southwell in 1920. Starring Godfrey Cass as Ned Kelly, the film includes both outdoor scenes and badly dressed roofless studio interiors that reflect Southwell’s inexperience as a producer.

results.title: Antonia: a portrait of the woman
results.creator_credit: Jill Godmilow, Judy Collins and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Presents a portrait of Antonia Brico, who in the 1930s established an international reputation as an accomplished orchestra conductor. Today she teaches conducting and piano in Denver, while leading the Brico Symphony, a community orchestra which she founded.

results.title: Amelia and the angel
results.creator_credit: Anthony G. Evans and Ken Russell
results.brief_description: A surreal fairy tale about a little girl in search of a pair of angel’s wings. The story is set in a background of London scenes, South Kensington, Earl’s Court, the Albert Memorial and Rotten Row. In the course of her search she visits a junk shop down the road, a jumble stall and finally tracks down a perfect pair of wings in a crazy artist’s studio. An interesting contrast is provided between the high-quality location photography and the surreal intrusions by a collection of fairy-tale characters. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Indonesia calling
results.creator_credit: Joris Ivens, Catherine Duncan and Waterside Workers' Federation of Australia. Film Unit.
results.brief_description: Appointed as film commissioner to the Dutch Indies, it was intended that Ivens would create educational films on behalf of the Dutch government and would document the liberation of Indonesia from Japanese occupation. When it became obvious that the Dutch government had no interest in granting independance to Indonesia, Ivens resigned. Working clandestinely, he recorded this film in support of the struggle by the Indonesian people to gain their independance. The film shows efforts by Australian dockworkers and striking Indonesian seamen to prevent the shipment of arms and ammunition to Indonesia aboard Dutch vessels. Cinematography, Marion Michelle. Editing, Joris Ivens and Jock Levy. Script, Joris Ivens and Catherine Duncan. Commentary, Peter Finch.
